required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tear Fluid Levels of Loteprednol Etabonate Ophthalmic Gel 0.5% Following a Single Instillation
clinical_study.official_title: Tear Fluid Levels of Loteprednol Etabonate Ophthalmic Gel 0.5% at 6, 9, 12, and 24 Hours Following a Single Instillation in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the levels of loteprednol etabonate (LE) in tear fluid following a single topical instillation of LE ophthalmic gel 0.5% formulation to healthy volunteers.

primary_outcome.description: Following a single dose of LE gel 0.5% administered into the study eye, tear samples will be collected via a Schirmer strip at 6, 9, 12 and 24 hours following the dose
Following a single dose of LE gel 0.5% administered into the study eye, tear samples will be collected via a Schirmer strip at 6, 9, 12 and 24 hours following the dose
Following a single dose of LE gel 0.5% administered into the study eye, tear samples will be collected via a Schirmer strip at 6, 9, 12 and 24 hours following the dose
Following a single dose of LE gel 0.5% administered into the study eye, tear samples will be collected via a Schirmer strip at 6, 9, 12 and 24 hours following the dose

arm_group.description: A single dose LE Gel 0.5% administered into the study eye, tear samples collected at 6, 9, 12, and 24 hours after instillation by Schirmer strip to measures levels of LE in tears.

intervention.description: Single drop of LE Gel 0.5% administered to the study eye on visit 2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects must be healthy volunteers with physiologically normal anterior segments not exhibiting clinically significant biomicroscopy findings.
- Subjects must have a best-corrected visual acuity of 20/20 or better in each eye.
- Subjects must have no active ocular disease or allergic conjunctivitis.
- Subjects must have a Schirmer test (without anesthesia) of ≥ 10mm in 5 minutes.
- Subjects must not be using any topical ocular medications or systemic medication other than acetaminophen.
- Male subjects or female subjects who are not of childbearing potential. Female subjects are considered to not be of childbearing potential if they are postmenopausal for at least 12 months or permanently sterilized (eg, tubal occlusion, hysterectomy, bilateral salpingectomy)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects having an intraocular pressure less than 5 mmHg or greater than 22 mmHg or any type of glaucoma.
- Subjects with a history of ocular trauma, infection, or inflammation within the last 3 months.
- Subjects having any contraindication to the use of, or known sensitivity or allergy to, the study drug(s) or their components.
- Subjects wearing contact lenses on the day of Visit 2 and/or Visit 3 of the study
- Subjects having, at the Investigator's discretion, the presence of any significant illness that could be expected to interfere with the study.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Single center, open label, single dose study in healthy volunteers. First participant enrolled 01/08/2013, last participant exited: 01/18/2013.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 17 participants were screened for this study. Of those screened, 12 participants were included to receive treatment; these subjects constituted the Safety population. No participants discontinued from the study.

group.description: A single dose LE Gel 0.5% administered into the study eye, tear samples collected at 6, 9, 12, and 24 hours after instillation by Schirmer strip to measures levels of LE in tears. LE Gel : Single drop of LE Gel 0.5% administered to the study eye on visit 2

outcome.title: Tear Fluid Levels
outcome.description: Following a single dose of LE gel 0.5% administered into the study eye, tear samples will be collected via a Schirmer strip at 6, 9, 12 and 24 hours following the dose
outcome.population: The primary analysis includes all subjects in the safety population with tear samples collected within the corresponding time window.

event.description: Non-Ocular Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events Population: Safety

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: All 12 subjects were exposed to a single dose of LE Gel.
